snippet: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation has taken some good first steps to regulating the biggest banks, and what's more, it's doing so in public, an economist writes.
abstract: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation has taken some good first steps to regulating the biggest banks, and what's more, it's doing so in public, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, the former chief economist at the International Monetary Fund, is the co-author of "13 Bankers."

headline.main: Progress on Letting Big Banks Fail

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
